Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 205. ==Events of the Kyūan Era== * 1145 (Kyūan 1, 8th month): Taiken-mon In, died. She was mother of former-Emperor Sutoku.Titsingh, p. 186. * 1146 (Kyūan 2, 2nd month), The emperor visited the home of former Emperor Toba. * 1146 (Kyūan 2, 12th month), Konoe joined Fujiwara no Tadamichi in celebrating his 58th birthday.Titsingh, p. 186; this event was important because, in each 60-year cycle, the 1st and the 58th years are lucky according to Chinese astrology. * 1148 (Kyūan 4, 6th month): In Heian-kyō (Kyoto), the imperial palace was destroyed by fire.Titsingh, p. 187. * 1150 (Kyūan 6, 1st month): Konoe married Fujiwara-no Tokoku. This bride became kōgū (first empress). * 1150 (Kyūan 6, 3rd month): Konoe took a second wife; and this bride became chūgyo (second empress). Konoe caused discord when he neglected his first wife. * 1150 (Kyūan 6, 12th month): Minamoto no Yoshikane became head of the Ashikaga clan in Shimotsuke province. ==Related pages == * Heian period == References == == Other websites == * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Kyūan 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th 7th Gregorian 1145 1146 1147 1148 1149 1150 1151 Preceded by: Ten'yō Era or nengō: Kyūan Succeeded by: Ninpei Category:Japanese eras
